title: Proposed Ban Changes
body:
Hey everyone. I'd like to run some changes by the community to the ban systems for Solo/Duo queue, Normal Draft, and Flex pick queues.

Currently, the ban system is good for most levels of play, but sometimes bans can feel like a waste with overlapping bans. This leaves a feeling of "I could/should've banned someone else", and it's not a good feeling. That's also not to say that the current ban system is bad, because it isn't. It is a streamlined draft for the current era of League, but we can do better.

Change 1 - Make all bans between both teams visible 

This is a simple fix. Currently, you and your team can see bans as you lock in to ban champions. This should be changed so both teams can see all bans the same way; If someone locks in a ban, it pops up for everyone.

Change 2 - Remove the ability to overlap bans

This just goes in tandem with Change 1, preventing overlap bans even if by accident.

Change 3 - Ban hovers are visible to teammates, but invisible to enemy team

This change prevents trolling basically, while also making you able to communicate or coordinate with your team.

EDIT: While this isn't a change and is the same as the current ban phase, this is something important that should be noted that would stay.

Change 4 - Remove "No Ban" option

There are too many champions to not ban something. This is just plain silly, otherwise, why are you even playing draft. 

And that's about it. Keep in mind this while this may be something that I put a lot of thought into, it really is just my opinion. I really am putting this out there to see if anyone else feels the same, or even disagrees with me and why.

Let me know what you all think!

replies.body: I agree with all of this post ^

I guess the intended tradeoff here is to have more champions banned per game vs time in champ select, but i'm not sure it would fully get what you're looking for.

First off, if you remove the option to not ban anything, what happens if you run the time out?

Second, it would incentivize banning as late in the timer as possible, as it might allow you to get an extra ban if the other team bans what you would've blindly banned.

And then to combine the two with the no-dups clause: if two people are looking to ban the same champion but holding out for the other team to ban until last second, the time will run out for one of them

My speculation would be that it would always make the ban phase take the full time (it does that somewhat regularly already, so idk how big a change that'd be in practice), and my guess would be it wouldn't average too many more champs banned per game anyways.  But would only know for sure by trying it.

Hm. I suppose Change 4 doesn't necessarily need to be implemented. If it were to be, though, not banning a champ would probably revert to dodging the lobby, just like before way back when.

I agree with your second point, but as you said, ban phases tend to run to the full time already anyway, so it might not be that bad.

Maybe Riot Games already tried this when they were looking to change the ban system to what it is now, and it didn't work. All of this is just speculation, and only rito knows for sure how this can be tested.

Thanks for your feedback! 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

seeing what enemy ban would directly give you advatange both for your pick or your ban, anyone will a little amount of brain will hold their ban until last moment to try and damage enemy team before picks even start.

Care to elaborate a little more? How would seeing enemy bans in solo queue etc. give advantages when we already see all 10 bans after they are locked in?

Remember, we are talking about ranked solo queue, ranked flex, and normal draft, where we only get 1 ban and 1 pick phase.
I agree with changes 1-3, 4 is really not a problem, its silly yea, but some people just dont care and i mean if u take away the no ban option, it just induces troll bans

You don't think someone that picks "no ban" is kind of trolly in a way?

I feel like change 4 would encourage some communication if someone doesn't have a ban. They could always ask what to ban if they don't have a preference, you know?

I suppose though, if people really do like the "No Ban" option, then it can stay. Like you said, it really isn't that big of an issue.
